website_summaries.verdict: For those who value efficiency and simplicity. This gadget produces tasty omelets in minutes using just your microwave oven.
pros: Holds up to four eggs, yet has a compact size that stores easily
Features a non-stick surface, which allows for fast clean up
Requires less cooking oil than most comparable models
cons: Some users report a chemical taste and smell when used at first

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I can pour 230 grams of egg whites, dice up mushrooms, tomatoes and a little cheese and then microwave it and within just a few minutes I have a 125 calorie egg white omelette that takes up half my plate!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McBride

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Tried 4times to cook 4 eggs setting the microwave at two minutes each time as recommended by the directions with microwave at different power levels: 100%, 70% 60% and 50% power. The first three times the eggs were solid/overcooked. The fourth time the eggs were completely liquid. I could’ve tried additional times at 50% power and increased the cook time, but I was done. I watched a Utube video on poaching eggs without any special device and was able to do so. I wish I had done that first. This was not very expensive, but still a waste of money for me. And now I have 16 eggs as cooked as a hard-boiled egg, to eat.
customer_reviews.author: casual shopper

customer_reviews.title: Uneven and unpredictable results
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, but it’s awful. I cook two eggs at a time. They are never evenly cooked. Last time, I did 55 seconds. Both were runny. Today, I put them on for a minute. The yolk of one was hard and the white of the other was runny. I know there are good versions out there as my friend has one. This isn’t good
customer_reviews.author: Andrew I. Capaloff

customer_reviews.title: Does What It's Supposed To
customer_reviews.text: The buying experience was excellent and the product is pretty much everything I expect from an item costing under five bucks. One thing, however, this item can, by no stretch of the imagination, be called "non-stick". The first egg I cooked in it stuck big time and had to be separated from the plastic surface with a fork.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bales

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works. Expect it not to be perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works mostly ok. Following directions, it seems one side never fully cools. I cant figure out why this is. When closed together, runny part usually cools, but not always. Works better if you don't try to make two halves, but near impossible to put cheese in the middle at that point. Can do shredded cheese throughout, but not the way I like my omelets. I like the cheese oozing out, sandwiched between both halves of the egg
customer_reviews.author: Russell Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, only issue is the directions are off a little unless you like really chewy omelette's. Reduce the cooking time and/or the heat setting -- still experimenting but getting real close to a perfect omelette.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Egg cooker! It's so easy to use - just add a tiny bit of water, then your eggs and 'go'! I am still playing with the timing for cooking as each microwave does cook differently, and also the piercing or not piercing of the yolk, but once you play with it a couple of times you will know exactly how to cook your eggs for the results you want! Easy to clean also - hot soapy water and it's clean in seconds. Right now I consider this a perfect purchase and the price was fantastic! When you can cook a meal in under 5 min 'and' clean up - well - need I say more!
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave poacher
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price and what it is superposed to do. You will have to try several times to find out what time in your own microwave is needed to get the desired yolk consistency. 1.20 is runny yolk, 1.30 is soft yolk and almost 2 min for hard cooked in my microwave. There is a learning curve but once you know the time and yolk consistency in your own microwave they turn out great every time. Super easy to clean. it's not non-stick but very little of the egg gets stuck in the cups after cooking. Super happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Eggtastic
customer_reviews.text: Works! 4 eggs 152 seconds in small microwave and perfect for me. Had to experiment took about 18 eggs,, but they were all close. I do not add water but do cut open yolk with egg shell. Buy some of this.
customer_reviews.author: Yumajoseph

customer_reviews.title: Place right in the center of a turntable microwave for even cooking
customer_reviews.text: I cook three eggs at a time, and put a tablespoon of water in the empty cup. I put it squarely in the center of my turntable microwave and cooked for 90 seconds. Eggs were evenly cooked, and perfectly "soft boiled" with runny yolks and solid whites. Came out of the cooker easily, and the cooker was easy to clean. No explosions or popping.
customer_reviews.author: sbwertz

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gadget!! I love it! My husband is diabetic, so I’m always trying to make him a high protein breakfast! It so easy to do so I can get out the door to work on time! It’s literally done in like 11/2 minutes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Impressive with a great price too!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this ite,m, I raved about it to family and friends a lot! Even gifted another to family member who lives eggs too! Super worth it! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rein J

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work with watter as it says on the instructions because its not easy to take out. I spray a little of coconut oil and works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Some might consider this too big for a 2 egg omlette, but when I make an omlette, I put lots of stuff in them! The instructions don't recommend putting oil, butter or anything else greasy in these, but I've had one like this before an a small squirt of PAM spray makes the foods slide out easier. Just remember to only use a SMALL squirt of PAM and spread the spray with a paper towel to get a light even coat.
customer_reviews.author: Home Decorator

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Anything that helps me cook in a microwave is great because I do not have time to do long cooking meals. This says it’s 30 seconds per egg, but I’ve found it takes a little longer. Each microwave is different so adjustments might be needed. Still a quick and easy way to poach eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Home Reflections, LLC

customer_reviews.title: WAY SMALLER THAN EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: What am I gonna do with it? Microwave half slice of bacon at a time? Lol. Thought it's gonna be as long as one slice. Will not work for me, so returning.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Cooks the eggs inconsistently.
customer_reviews.text: I was very much looking forward to this so used it right away. It was very disappointing. It said to cook in the microwave at “medium-med/high” heat. Not sure exactly how this correlated to the microwave I cooked 4 eggs at 50% power for the recommended time. One egg was almost hard boiled, one might have been ok, but two were almost raw. I put the 2 back in for 30 seconds at 100% power, one was perfect, the other overdone. My microwave tray turns so I don’t know what is the issue. I guess I’ll have to ply with it more.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth waratuke

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price! You have to play around a bit with your own microwave to figure out the best timing for your preference of doneness. My daughter and I each have one and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: breakfast time made easy!!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to use and easy to clean. Microwave times vary depending on wattage and how many eggs you poach at one time but it took no time to figure out the right time for me! It is simple to use and makes breakfast time a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Katie P.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The product is not worth a dollar. The top does not stay on and the plastic is very cheap. It was broken when it arrived but the package it came in was perfect. I think a dollar store product would be better than this product.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnne Alsobrook

customer_reviews.title: Best lazy breakfast ever
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, does what it says. A little water left in the bottom when you scoop the egg out. Thats it. So easy .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eggs a little watery but easily solved, quick to cook eggs.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, eggs are a little watery after and I soak them on a paper towel to get rid of the excess water before prepping my breakfast sandwiches for the week.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Best $5 I ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: I don't EVER have to make breakfast now! We have already saved way more than we paid in time and money. The only thing that you really need to know other than following the directions is don't forget to add milk! If you don't add milk to the eggs, you will probably be cleaning the microwave :) I am NEVER ordering a $8 omelet again. These come out fluffy and better than the local restaurants.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: Makes great omelets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work so I can have omelets works really good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean
customer_reviews.text: Cooks great but pockets could be a little deeper,I only buy jumbo eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Quick, easy, perfectly poached eggs! Our family uses this several times a week for a quick breakfast!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon s.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's so easy to make an omelet with it. My new favorite kitchen gadget! My picture has Hash browns, ham, onions, peppers, cheese and 3 eggs. Microwaved for about 3 minutes. I like mine well done. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not deep enough
customer_reviews.text: The poacher works fine but the wells for the eggs need to be a little deeper. They are too small for large eggs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It does not work. The eggs come out totally runny or totally done. Tried several different times using different amounts of microwave time to see if I could get it to work. Disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: its great for work
customer_reviews.text: i can have eggs any where just a drop of water an egg 30 seconds for one 2 minutes for 4 a microwave done breakfast on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: teresa m

customer_reviews.title: Won’t cook evenly
customer_reviews.text: 2,3or4 eggs are either overlooked or undercooked- cannot get consistency on more than one egg!!
customer_reviews.author: William Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy! Omlette's came out great!!!!! Soo happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Lissette Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it right
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were vague, either rubbery or runny eggs every time
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Cooks very unevenly, burns outside edges and leaves middle runny when following the directions.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a different microwave omelette maker that belongs to my friend. I thought since it looks the same it should work the same. Well, I was wrong. This yellow omelette maker cooks very enevenly and overcooks the outer edges while leaving the middle very runny. I'm disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick omelettes in microwave
customer_reviews.text: It's what I'd expect from making an omelette in the microwave versus on the stove. So time wise it makes a super quick omelette. Clean up is easy. The omelette usually borders on slightly undercooked, or over cooked. I still haven't the perfect timing needed to get it to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Duerr

customer_reviews.title: Worked as Described
customer_reviews.text: Product worked as described. Eggs taste good when prepared this way.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Macik

customer_reviews.title: Works, but should be $0.99
customer_reviews.text: This is works but it only worth $0.99. Cheap plastic tool.
customer_reviews.author: Doug V

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this0
customer_reviews.text: Eggs kept coming out with the yolks hard and the whites watery.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh...
customer_reviews.text: I really didn’t like this. It made my eggs taste rubbery and had a horrible flavor. Not really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Oshirak

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect egg poacher! This is now part of my morning process. So easy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy for someone with minimal time like me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hazelwood

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very good for poached eggs. Easier to use and clean than those with drainer layers
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Cooks the eggs well in the microwave. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Barton

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product but it was terrible. It burst open while cooking within a few seconds of first use. It had been securely closed too. I threw it away as it wasn’t worth trouble of a return.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this egg poacher. It's difficult to cook to the right softness. After 3 attempts to poach the eggs, still not able to make it work. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Best $6 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by the New York Times. It does not disappoint. No more messy pans of simmering water and egg stuck to the bottom. Just quick, clean, easy poached eggs. I am so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eggtastic!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and clean! Perfect omelettes every time!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: It’s fool proof!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Easy to use. Makes a professional looking omelet in less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby B

customer_reviews.title: great for the office
customer_reviews.text: Cleans easy, and very easy to use I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Omelette
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and it does the omelettes really well..
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Microwave egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: This is the best microwave egg poacher on the market..
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: I was hopeful!
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy to clean as the product description explains.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: Easiest and fastest way to make an omelette! Clean up is a breeze too!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing poacher
customer_reviews.text: I love that this takes less time to make Eggs Benedict than it does to boil water & it's easy to clean. My base time is 2 minutes AT 80 POWER with a 1,000 watt microwave. Adjust cooking times by +/- 10 seconds per 100 watts ie. use 1:40 (at 80 POWER) for a 1,200 watt microwave. Make sure the poacher is in the center and follow the instructions - 1/2 tsp of water under and over each egg (1 tsp total). If you forget to use 80 power, your egg will be hard. I hope this helps...
customer_reviews.author: B. Sedgwick

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim after seeing CrazyRussianHacker use it. I figured it would be a cheap toy. It is a cheap toy but the darn thing works! I did it without adding a little milk and then with adding just a touch of milk. The cook time increases if you add even a little milk. However, both versions were fine. It makes an easy no mess omelette. I added sausage and cheese after the first cook cycle (1.5 minutes) and then when it was folded over, all the stuff stayed in although it wasn't a 'sealed' omelette. It presents well and is quick. Buy it. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Creagan

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great, quick egg pacher for microwave. Takes a few tries to get the time right for multiple eggs on power level 7, for 2 eggs it is about 100 seconds for soft slightly runny yolk
customer_reviews.author: Joel Goodson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it noooow!!
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing thing ever!!!! You don’t need to use a pan anymore for omelettes! My husband and I are amazed and telling everybody about this wonderful creation! 4 eggs, bacon, cheese and you get a yummy omelette and nothing gets stick in the plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn

customer_reviews.title: Best in class microwave omelette maker
customer_reviews.text: Best one, reinforced hinge (can become important when taking it out of the microwave with a hot cheese omelette inside as you carefully avoid getting burned. Cooks well. Cleans well. Built solid.
customer_reviews.author: JDR in the USA

customer_reviews.title: Easy & quick
customer_reviews.text: Love this - makes 1-2 quickly, cleans easily. There's a bit of a learning curve on the timing, depend on the microwave
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Sucks. Blows up egg in microwave. Amazon didn't even want it back. Refunded my money
customer_reviews.author: kim johnson

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my adult life?! Easy to use and clean and the omelette is fluffier than a skillet version. Be careful to follow directions and not overcook. Overcooking will make the omelette chewy. We’ve added chopped peppers, tomatoes and bacon crumbles to make a healthy breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: KJay

customer_reviews.title: Quick and no mess
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great omlet once you figure out how long to cook in microwave.. Had to experiment a little to get correct time.
customer_reviews.author: ucandoit

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Made from heavy duty durable plastic. Rags don’t stick and very easy to use. You will probably have to learn exactly how long to cook them for so they don’t come out rubbery. Quick and easy way to pick a couple of eggs for breakfast!
customer_reviews.author: TomP

customer_reviews.title: Handy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for me the first time I used it! So much faster & easier than on top of the stove! Very glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: LisaC.

customer_reviews.title: Kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: So I'm not so impressed with the taste of an omelet made in the microwave however, i like the easy clean up and I have kids that will be able to make it by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi

customer_reviews.title: Easy & fast poached eggs in a minute!!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this poacher is to use. It’s nice to get perfectly poached eggs in a minute
customer_reviews.author: Karen McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made out of flimsy plastic this my third time using this 1st time eggs stuck and had to be scraped off the inside of my microwave as the top had popped off and spewed eggs everywhere after 30 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Love it for poached eggs!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for poached eggs! Super quick & easy. Don’t use warm/hot water though, I did without thinking and it exploded in my microwave lol!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Too Big for Me
customer_reviews.text: Omelet best with 2-4 eggs. Too big for my purposes. Packaged instructions, ideas for use could be much better.
customer_reviews.author: PAK

customer_reviews.title: Best omelet maker!
customer_reviews.text: They used to sell something similar at Walmart. So glad I found this on!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet_Melissa

customer_reviews.title: So much easier to make omelets & much quicker.
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use & omelets taste so good!
customer_reviews.author: Erv & Dori

customer_reviews.title: Timing
customer_reviews.text: Never could get the timing right. Too done or not done.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: No Comment
customer_reviews.text: Didn't quite work as I thought it would, omelette look kind of funny.
customer_reviews.author: Homer M. Morimoto

customer_reviews.title: Best thing you didn’t know you needed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this every morning for the past year it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Value for price.. BF TOOL
customer_reviews.text: 4 eggs.. takes much longer.. possible rubbery outcome.. it’s just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Progressive International Omelette Maker, 4 Eggs, Yellow
product_meta.description: Size:4 Eggs| Style Name:Omelete MakerThe prep solutions by progressive microwave omelet maker can create a quick and delicious omelet for breakfast, as a snack or dinner in the microwave. Just add eggs and filling to our microwave omelet maker, place in the microwave and in minutes enjoy a perfect omelet. The non-stick surface makes cleaning fast and easy. This omelet maker can hold up to 4 eggs and is BPA free and dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: QUICK AND EASY: The Prep Solutions by Progressive Microwave Omelet Maker can create a quick and delicious omelet for breakfast, as a snack or dinner in the microwave
ENJOY IN MINUTES: Just add eggs and filling to our microwave omelet maker, place in the microwave and in minutes enjoy a perfect omelet
NONSTICK COATING ENSURES EASY CLEANING: The non-stick surface makes cleaning fast and easy
LARGE CAPACITY UP TO 4 EGGS: This omelet maker can hold up to 4 eggs
BPA FREE AND DISHWASHER SAFE: It is BPA Free and Dishwasher Safe
